intro: Lappago decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive lappago, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically oval and have a smooth texture, while its roots are fibrous and can be harvested for medicinal purposes. Lappago decipiens is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
